items.title: Natural Gas Futures Stabilize as Traders Monitor Early January Cold Risks
items.summary: Natural gas futures shook off early weakness Friday, rallying into the close to climb back above $4.000/MMBtu as traders watched for signs that January forecasts could turn colder.

items.title: Bulls Grip Even as Historic Warmth Limits Midday Natural Gas Futures Rally
items.summary: January natural gas futures edged higher through midday Friday, even as weak demand and robust production continued to feed bearish sentiment.

items.title: Ontario Natural Gas Storage Slips Below Historic Norms Amid Coldest Winter Start in 25 Years
items.summary: Natural gas storage levels in Ontario reached their lowest level for this time of year in more than a decade, pressured by an unusually cold start to the heating season and robust demand.

items.title: Bearish Forecasts Sink Natural Gas Forward Prices, Though Canada Basis Climbs
items.summary: Natural gas forwards posted steep declines during the Dec. 10–17 trading period as forecasts turned bearish in a stark departure from the month’s chilly first half.

items.title: Energy Transfer Drops Plans for Lake Charles LNG After Lengthy Battle to Develop Project
items.summary: Energy Transfer LP (ET) said late Thursday it would suspend development of the Lake Charles LNG project planned for Louisiana, saying instead it would focus on a “significant backlog” of natural gas pipeline infrastructure that needs to be built.

items.title: Natural Gas Futures Fade After Early Bounce as Storage, Weather Pressure Prices
items.summary: An early attempt by natural gas futures to claw higher Friday fizzled as weak demand expectations and a slowdown in storage draws continued to pressure the market.

items.title: Following Nearly In-Line Storage Result, Natural Gas Futures Fail to Sustain Upward Momentum
items.summary: A bullish government inventory print — relative to historic norms — along with hints of January cold and strong LNG volumes were not enough to keep natural gas futures in the green on Thursday.

items.title: Mexico Natural Gas Imports Edge Higher as U.S. Prices Ease
items.summary: Natural gas imports into Mexico climbed over the past week as U.S. prices moderated from early December peaks.

items.title: Bullish Hopes Fade Midday; Traders Sell Natural Gas After Storage Data Miss
items.summary: Natural gas futures tumbled Thursday afternoon after the U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA) storage data came in slightly below expectations, suggesting supply would be sufficient to meet weaker demand.

items.title: Trump’s Venezuela Campaign Disrupts an $8 Billion Oil Trade
items.summary: Oil tankers are diverting from their route to Venezuela; some are sitting idle at ports instead of setting off for Asia; discounts on Venezuelan crude are deepening; and PDVSA may soon start shutting down wells for lack of storage space. President Tr

items.title: Does the U.K. Need More Domestic Gas Production?
items.summary: There are rising concerns that the United Kingdom’s gas security is under threat and that not enough is being done to mitigate the risk. Chris O’Shea, the CEO of Centrica, which owns British Gas, has called the government out for not paying enough at

items.title: The EIA Thinks OPEC Can Pump More Than Anyone Expected
items.summary: The U.S. Energy Information Administration quietly rewrote a key assumption about the global oil market this week: OPEC can produce more oil than previously thought. In its December Short-Term Energy Outlook, the EIA updated how it defines and estima

items.title: Guyana Is Using Its Oil Revenues to Spark a Renewable Energy Boom
items.summary: Since the discovery of vast oil reserves in Guyana around a decade ago, the South American country’s oil industry has grown significantly following investment from several international oil majors and the beginning of offshore production. As Guyana b

items.title: What Happens to a Sanctioned Oil Tanker?
items.summary: A 58,000-ton oil tanker called the Mikati was ploughing through the waters of the Indian Ocean one day when it got some bad news from faraway Brussels: it had been added to a list of sanctioned vessels in Russia’s shadow fleet. The story of the Mikat

items.title: The Battery Boom Is Reshaping Power Markets
items.summary: The uptake of utility-scale battery storage has grown significantly in recent years as more countries switch to renewables. Battery storage ensures that grids powered by less reliable energy sources, such as wind and solar power, can continue to deli
